question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee, will Glenn Youngkin also be the nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is Glenn Youngkin also selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as YES if Glenn Youngkin is indeed selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, despite Larry Elder also being selected. It resolves as NO if Glenn Youngkin is not selected. Note that this scenario is logically inconsistent under typical single-nominee conditions.

para_P.title: If Larry Elder is the Republican candidate, will Glenn Youngkin be the candidate as well?

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the nomination of the Democratic Party for the presidency?

This resolves identically to the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept his party's nomination for a new term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt about Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Further details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.body:

question.title: Conditional on Kamala's odds of winning increasing over the next week, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model. Specifically, this means that the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

In that case, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will refuse the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive. If such a declaration is not made by the specified time, this will be deemed No.

Then can we say that Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President? This resolves the same as the original on Metaculus. 

Resolution criteria for Biden's declaration: This question will resolve as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, *as of* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or changes that may happen *after* the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that by July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

Resolution criteria for Glenn Youngkin: Resolves Yes if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee.

Resolution criteria for Nikki Haley: Resolves Yes if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away prior to Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is an official declaration regarding Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be deemed a NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office as President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) will not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Conditional on Biden remaining President through end of July 2024, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this condition.

Given this condition, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? Resolves YES if such an announcement occurs before this deadline, otherwise resolves NO.

Note: If Biden ceases to be President before the end of July 2024 for any reason other than temporary transfer of power, this question resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If Biden stays in office until the end of July 2024, will Joe Biden pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Biden continues as the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This implies he does not resign, die, or otherwise stop being President prior to that date. A temporary power transfer under the 25th amendment does not alter this stipulation.

Under this premise, will there be an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th? The outcome will be YES if such an announcement is made before this cutoff, otherwise it will be NO.

Note: If Biden is no longer President before the end of July 2024 for any cause other than a temporary transfer of power, this inquiry will resolve as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on Biden ceasing to be President before the end of July 2024, will Biden die before Saturday?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Biden ceases to be President before the end of July 2024. This could happen if Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET); however, a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count. Given this, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? Resolves YES if such an announcement is made, otherwise resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Biden stops being President prior to the conclusion of July 2024, will he pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body: Assume the following situation holds: Biden stops being President before the conclusion of July 2024. This could occur if Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise no longer holds the position of US President before the end of July 2024 (ET); however, a temporary handover of authority under the 25th amendment does not count. Given this scenario, will there be an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th? Resolves YES if such a declaration is made, otherwise resolves NO.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The answer will be "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent changes that might occur after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the defined grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the answer will be negative.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal for an early nomination of Biden?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, arguing that it suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He chose not to confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will conclude YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even multiple letters that together have a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will conclude NO.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If there are 10 or more Democratic Senators indicating this before midnight on July 20 Central Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

Context for Q: Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned. A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman, offers a public signal from Democrats that scores of their own members remain unsettled about Biden’s candidacy.

Resolution criteria for Q: This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures are sufficient. If these criteria are not met by market close, it resolves NO.

Suppose the following is true: 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20. Then, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

para_P.title: Should 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw prior to July 20, will there be at least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate who will endorse a public statement against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Criteria for resolving P: If, before midnight Central Time on July 20, the source indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators have called for Biden to withdraw, then P will be considered YES. If not, it will be NO.

Context for the question: Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a response to voice their opposition to their party's attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than initially planned. A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman serves as a public indication that many members of their party are apprehensive about Biden’s candidacy.

Criteria for resolving Q: This will be YES if a public letter against the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. It is acceptable for multiple letters to have a total of 20 signatures combined. If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, it will be NO.

Assuming the following is accurate: 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to withdraw before July 20. Then, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats endorse a public letter opposing the initiative to virtually nominate Biden early?

question.title: Given fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20. This means that at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, does the resolution source show 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out.

Then, is the following true? At least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES.

If fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20 and the criteria for the public letter are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: If fewer than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20, will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate express their opposition to the plan of virtually nominating Biden early through a public letter?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Less than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign before July 20. This indicates that at no time before midnight on July 20 Central Time does the resolution source indicate 10 or more Democratic Senators urging Biden to resign.

Is it then accurate to say that at least 20 Democrats from either the House or Senate will sign a public letter against the plan to virtually nominate Biden early? This will be considered a YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Additionally, multiple letters that collectively have 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES.

Conversely, if fewer than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign before July 20 and the requirements for the public letter are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators push Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two secure-seat members have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most at-risk Democrats have informed local news sources that they’ve already dismissed Biden’s chances for victory in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these would urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request that Joe Biden consider terminating his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as mentioned above, but it might also occur through a group meeting with Biden where they collectively ask him to withdraw.

For a YES resolution, all five individuals must be part of the same collective message. Five individuals independently informing reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is not sufficient for a YES outcome.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats communicating with Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek nor accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be marked as No.

Further details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Reliable users are encouraged to resolve this market early if the result is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request early resolution or report any issues.

question.title: Given that Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure him to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, public, and unambiguous, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle.

Then, is it true that a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators will work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

This requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message, such as signing a letter or collectively speaking with Biden. Separate individual statements are insufficient. Furthermore, reports must include the names of at least five individuals, confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, before the market's end date. In ambiguous cases, the resolution will err towards NO.

If these criteria are not met by July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden makes a public declaration prior to July 15, 2024, stating that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on him to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This declaration must be clear, public, and unequivocal, allowing no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle.

Then, is it the case that a coalition consisting of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators will collaborate to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

This necessitates that all five individuals participate in a unified group communication, such as co-signing a letter or collectively addressing Biden. Individual statements made separately will not suffice. Additionally, reports must identify at least five individuals, verified beyond a reasonable doubt, prior to the market's closing date. In cases of uncertainty, the resolution will lean towards NO.

If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden not announcing before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure him to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This means that prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, neither Joe Biden nor his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement declaring that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

Then, is it true that a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

The group must be cohesive, meaning that they must be part of the same group message, such as signing a letter or collectively speaking with Biden. Five people separately expressing their opinion is not sufficient. The names of the individuals must be made public, and if there is ambiguity, the resolution errs towards NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, the resolution is NO.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden does not declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on him to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden refrains from announcing prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This implies that before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, neither Joe Biden nor his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

Then, is it accurate to say that a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

The group must act in unison, meaning they must be part of a collective communication, such as signing a letter or jointly addressing Biden. Five individuals expressing their views independently is not adequate. The identities of these individuals must be disclosed, and in cases of uncertainty, the decision should lean towards NO. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, the answer is NO.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

In this context, "broadly accessible" means that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (potentially requiring a subscription). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or restricted for certain groups (like minors), it will still count as a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

Here, "ChatGPT" refers specifically to the general web platform (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still count positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

Then, will Latvia also qualify for the Grand Final? Latvia needs to participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for this to resolve as Yes. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as No.

In that case, will Latvia also secure a spot in the Grand Final? Latvia must take part in a Semi-final and be recognized by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for the answer to be Yes. Should Latvia fail to qualify, the answer will be No.

Resolution criteria:
- For Belgium: Resolves Yes if Belgium fails to qualify as per the official announcement by the EBU.
- For Latvia: Resolves Yes if Latvia qualifies for the Grand Final as per the official announcement by the EBU. Resolves No otherwise.

Assuming the following holds true: Belgium takes part in a Semi-final and is declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Latvia make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For Belgium: Resolves Yes if Belgium is stated to not qualify according to the official announcement by the EBU.
- For Latvia: Resolves Yes if Latvia is confirmed to qualify for the Grand Final according to the official announcement by the EBU. Resolves No in all other cases.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains within the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Russian dominance over the area



The inquiry will resolve as **No** if the location is not evaluated to be in any of the classifications indicating Russian dominance, which includes but is not limited to:

- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Ukrainian dominance over the area or a lack of Russian dominance over the area

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden not accepting the Democratic nomination, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, public, and official, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. Given this condition, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden does not accept the Democratic nomination, will Russia have control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden makes a public, official, and unequivocal announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination. This announcement must eliminate any possibility of Biden accepting the nomination during the 2024 election cycle. Under this condition, will Russia possess control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

The outcome will be determined as **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of the following classifications:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area

The question will be resolved as **No** if the location is not classified under any categories that suggest Russian control, which includes, but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control.

question.title: Suppose Joe Biden does not announce by July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination. Will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This means there is no unambiguous and conclusive statement from Biden or his campaign refusing the nomination.

Given this condition, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden fails to declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Russia have authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden does not issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for the presidency in the 2024 election cycle. This implies that there is no clear and definitive communication from Biden or his campaign rejecting the nomination.

Under this premise, will Russia possess control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, when reviewed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any of the following classifications:

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine
- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours
- Evaluated Russian Authority
- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian authority over the area.

The inquiry will resolve as **No** if the area is not categorized in any of the classifications that suggest Russian authority, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours
- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Activities
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian authority over the area or a lack of Russian authority over the area.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to the inclusion of other candidates beyond those currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it doesn't matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump not being charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024. Then is Vivek Ramaswamy selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in the specified case before June 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves No otherwise.

para_P.title: Assuming Donald Trump is not indicted for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024, will Vivek Ramaswamy become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024. Under these circumstances, will Vivek Ramaswamy be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Criteria for the condition to be satisfied: Resolves Yes if Donald Trump is not charged or indicted concerning statements about potential witnesses in the specified case before June 1, 2024.

Criteria for the outcome to be satisfied: Resolves Yes if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves No in all other cases.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve **Yes** if, after the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, trustworthy reports suggest that an attack linked to Israel has taken place within Iran, resulting in the deaths of no fewer than five people.

question.title: Will Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Is Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name going to be part of the approved candidates list by Iran's Guardian Council for the presidential election?
para_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is listed among the qualified candidates for president by Iran's Guardian Council in the forthcoming election.

question.title: If Iran's Guardian Council approves Ahmadinejad as a presidential candidate, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Iran's Guardian Council includes Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran. This means that Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

Then, we want to know if Israel will carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024. This resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Should Iran's Guardian Council endorse Ahmadinejad as a candidate for the presidency, will Israel execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name appears on the list of candidates approved by Iran's Guardian Council for the presidential election. This indicates that Ahmadinejad is recognized as a viable candidate by Iran's Guardian Council for the forthcoming presidential race.

We seek to determine whether Israel will conduct a lethal strike within Iran before May 1, 2024. This is considered **Yes** if, after the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible sources report that an attack attributed to Israel has taken place within Iran, resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: If Iran's Guardian Council excludes Ahmadinejad, will Israel carry out a deadly attack in Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Iran's Guardian Council excludes Mahmoud Ahmadinejad from its list of approved presidential candidates. This means that Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is not included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election. 

Then, is the following also true: Before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals?

para_P.title: Should Iran's Guardian Council decide to eliminate Ahmadinejad from the candidate list, will Israel execute a lethal strike in Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following premise holds: Iran's Guardian Council removes Mahmoud Ahmadinejad from its roster of sanctioned presidential candidates. This indicates that Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is not part of the qualified candidates approved by Iran's Guardian Council for the forthcoming presidential election. 

Then, can it also be stated that before May 1, 2024, reliable sources report that an assault linked to Israel and taking place within Iran has resulted in the deaths of no fewer than five people?

question.body:

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will the Republican Party maintain control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly represented by Bill Johnson) during the special election in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting information from popular sources, an official statement or source from Ohio State will be referenced. Should there be no election conducted prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be deemed void.

question.title: Conditional on the Republican Party retaining Ohio's 6th congressional district, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two political events:

1. The Republican Party retaining Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election. This will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

2. Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

The question asks: Suppose the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election, then will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?

para_P.title: If the Republican Party maintains control of Ohio's 6th congressional district, will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between two political occurrences:

1. The Republican Party maintaining control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election. This will be confirmed as Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases where popular sources disagree, an Ohio State source or statement will be considered. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the question will be void.

2. Joe Biden making a declaration before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This will be confirmed as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign delivers a clear, public, official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unmistakable and definitive.

The question posed is: Assuming the Republican Party maintains control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?

question.title: Given the Republican Party loses Ohio's 6th district in the 2024 special election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Republican Party loses Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson, in the 2024 special election. This means credible sources report that a person not representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? For this to resolve as Yes, Joe Biden or his campaign must make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to the specified time, this question resolves as No.

para_P.title: If the Republican Party fails to secure Ohio's 6th district in the special election of 2024, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Republican Party does not win Ohio's 6th congressional district, which was previously occupied by Bill Johnson, in the special election of 2024. This indicates that credible reports confirm a candidate not affiliated with the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases where popular sources conflict, an official statement or source from Ohio will be utilized. Should no election occur before January 1, 2025, the inquiry is considered void.

Then, is it accurate that Joe Biden will make a public announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? For this to be answered affirmatively, Joe Biden or his campaign must issue a clear, public, and official declaration indicating that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for a subsequent term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, allowing no interpretation that Biden might accept the nomination. If such a clear statement is not issued prior to the designated time, this question will be answered negatively.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

para_P.title: Could the Deadpool & Wolverine film achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film? [surpassing Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
para_P.body:
Experts are forecasting a massive opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The movie, helmed by Shawn Levy and featuring Ryan Reynolds, is anticipated to generate between $340 million and $360 million worldwide during its opening weekend. This would set a new record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film. In the domestic market, it is expected to launch with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated debut in history.

"""

[image]The current record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the upcoming film surpass these figures? It seems likely to be very close...

It will definitely be shown in more theaters... Deadpool was a phenomenal success at the time, and somewhat unexpected.

Since BoxOfficeMojo has some quirks in reporting international opening weekends -- it presents the raw figures but aggregates them oddly -- we will wait for the Hollywood Reporter to confirm the weekend's opening numbers.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine earns more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or similar publication) confirms it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

In other words, the BoxOfficeMojo figures should be regarded as unofficial until there is confirmation in the Hollywood press. The target number we are aiming for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

question.title: Given Deadpool & Wolverine has the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie, will Taylor Swift cameo in it?
question.body:

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie, surpassing the original Deadpool's record of $284.5M globally.

Suppose the above condition is met. Then, will Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?

Resolution criteria for outcome Q:

Assuming the above condition is satisfied, will Taylor Swift make an appearance in Deadpool and Wolverine?

Criteria for determining outcome Q:

This would set a record for the highest opening weekend for an R-rated film. In the domestic market, the film is projected to launch with $160 million to $170 million, making it the largest R-rated opening in history.

The current record for the highest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool, which earned $284.5M ($152.2M domestically).

Is it likely that this new film will surpass these figures? It seems it will be close...

To clarify the resolution...
-> this market will resolve to YES if Deadpool x Wolverine earns $284.5M or less globally during its opening weekend based on reports
-> OR if the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) does not classify it as the record for an R-rated movie release

Assuming the above is accurate. Then, will Taylor Swift make a cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?

It resolves to YES if she features in the film in any capacity, even if it is merely her voice used for a character. It will still resolve to YES if she is not credited on IMDB, provided it is confirmed by independent sources.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If he does not, then the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Given this scenario, we are interested in whether Biden will drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

para_P.title: Assuming Will Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In light of this situation, we seek to determine if Biden will withdraw or be incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20.

Criteria for the condition: Will Hurd is nominated by the delegates of the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
