question.title: Given that Will Hurd is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any other candidate is selected as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time? If Biden drops out or is unable to continue before this date and time, the outcome resolves as Yes. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

para_P.title: Assuming that Will Hurd does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario: Will Hurd is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This implies that another candidate is appointed as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Under these circumstances, is it accurate to say that Biden will exit the race or be otherwise incapable of continuing before midnight Eastern Time on July 20? If Biden exits or cannot proceed before this specified date and time, the outcome will be Yes. If not, it will be No.

question.title: Will OpenAI publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that OpenAI will release a report detailing the outcomes from an outside red-team evaluation of their models for safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **YES** if, on or before June 30, 2024, OpenAI issues a *public* report that includes the findings from an *external* organization assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will Anthropic publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Anthropic will release a report detailing findings from independent red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic issues a *public* report that includes the findings from an *external* entity conducting red-teaming on the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Given Anthropic publishes a report with external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI do the same?
question.body:
This question explores whether OpenAI will publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024, given that Anthropic does so by that date. 

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): The condition is satisfied if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): Resolves YES if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If Anthropic releases a report featuring external red-teaming findings by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI follow suit?
para_P.body:
This inquiry investigates whether OpenAI will issue a public report detailing outcomes from an external entity red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024, contingent upon Anthropic's publication by that deadline. 

Criteria for assessing the condition (P): The condition is deemed fulfilled if Anthropic publishes a public report with findings from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome (Q): Resolves to YES if OpenAI publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. Resolves to NO otherwise. If the condition is unmet, it resolves to N/A.

question.title: If Anthropic does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI publish such a report?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Anthropic does not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Then, will OpenAI publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by the same date? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Anthropic does not publish the specified report by June 30, 2024.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if OpenAI publishes the specified report by June 30, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.
If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Should OpenAI release a report on external red-teaming results if Anthropic fails to do so by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming this scenario holds: By June 30, 2024, Anthropic has not made available a *public* report detailing the findings from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models. In that case, will OpenAI issue a *public* report concerning the findings from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models by the same deadline? 

Criteria for determining the condition: The condition is satisfied if Anthropic does not release the specified report by June 30, 2024.
Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if OpenAI issues the specified report by June 30, 2024. Resolves to NO otherwise.
If the condition is not satisfied, resolves to N/A.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves as YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves as NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time.

A temporary power transfer under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump be disqualified or barred from participating in the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden remain President through July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements do not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition is not met.

Then, is it true that Biden will remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden remains President through the end of July 2024. It resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump is disqualified from participating in a primary election due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden continue to hold the presidency until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be validated by official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, personal opinions, or unofficial statements do not count as valid confirmation. The inquiry specifically focuses on whether Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot but is later reinstated, meaning that as of July 15 he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, then the condition is not satisfied.

In that case, can we confirm that Biden will remain the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET)? This question will yield a YES if Biden is still President at the end of July 2024. It will yield a NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary handover of authority under the 25th amendment (designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a NO answer, as the role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump not being removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This is confirmed by the lack of official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such a removal or block.

Then is it true that Biden will remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden remains President through that time, and NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this resolution.

para_P.title: Assuming Donald Trump is not prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden continue to be President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially barred or removed from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is verified by the absence of formal announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources reporting any such barring or removal.

In that case, can we say that Biden will still hold the office of President of the United States through the end of July 2024 (ET)? The answer is YES if Biden remains in office during that period, and NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before then. A temporary handover of power under the 25th amendment does not change this outcome.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not go beyond 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined based on the advantage that Donald Trump holds over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign provides a clear, public, official declaration stating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3? This is based on the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden declare that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination prior to July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden makes a clear, public, and official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will neither seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and final, eliminating any chance that Biden may reconsider the nomination.

Then, can we confirm that Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3? This is derived from the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number indicates a lead for Biden.

question.title: If Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This means there is no definitive, public, official announcement from Biden or his campaign indicating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle.

Given this scenario, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This question will resolve based on the value reported on 538's national polling average chart for the date of July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden fail to declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination, will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden does not make a declaration before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This implies that there is no clear, public, official statement from Biden or his campaign signifying that he will not seek or accept the nomination for another term as President in the 2024 election cycle.

In light of this situation, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and not more than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? The resolution of this question will rely on the figure reported on 538's national polling average chart for the date of July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden. For instance, a figure of 2.4 signifies that Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points.

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Republican Party to keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly occupied by Bill Johnson) in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude affirmatively if reliable sources indicate that a candidate affiliated with the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports from popular sources, a statement or source from Ohio State will be referenced. If no election occurs prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be deemed void.

question.title: Given the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district, will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

para_P.title: If the Republican Party holds onto Ohio's 6th congressional district, will Liz Cheney become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This indicates that reliable sources confirm a Republican candidate has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. question.title: Given the Republican Party loses Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

para_P.title: If the Republican Party fails to secure Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, will Liz Cheney become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This inquiry explores the possible consequences of the Republican Party's failure to retain Ohio's 6th congressional district on Liz Cheney's prospects of being the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement asserting that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a "No" if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden as per the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. Should Biden and Trump have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the numbers shown by the blue and red trend lines on the date of resolution. Any adjustments in the method FiveThirtyEight uses to derive its figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It may remain unresolved until the July 20 data is available. If data for July 19 is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest preceding figures to July 19.

Please be aware that resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations won by each candidate out of 1,000 will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a collective of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators compel Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local news outlets that they have given up on Biden's chances for victory in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. Various drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one draft would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will be resolved as YES if a collective of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to urge Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to press him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as mentioned above, or through other means such as a group meeting with Biden in person and jointly requesting him to withdraw.

It is necessary for all five individuals to be part of the same collective message. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat, will he see an increase of at least 3% among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a typical Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys regularly indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in hypothetical scenarios either leads or is within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the broader public opinion?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. Otherwise, the answer will be NO.

These polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will remain open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that fewer than five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.body:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to exit the race. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these drafts would request that Biden withdraw from the presidential race, as reported by five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve YES if fewer than five named Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate collaborate to request that Joe Biden consider stepping aside from his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could involve signing a letter as mentioned above, or it might take the form of a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively ask him to withdraw.

For a YES resolution, it is essential that fewer than five individuals are involved in the same collective message. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, this will not be adequate for a YES outcome.

Any reports regarding unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and urging him to step down will not fulfill the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market closes. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If the specified conditions are not met by July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves YES if, on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is higher than Apple's, as determined by Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as per 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

A positive figure signifies a Trump advantage.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

The medal standings are determined by summing the total medals earned by each competing nation and ranking them by:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Total Silver Medals

Criteria for resolution:
- Regarding the condition: Georgia is considered to have failed to qualify if it does not compete in a Semi-final or is officially stated by the EBU as not having qualified for the Grand Final.
- Concerning the outcome: Czechia qualifies if it competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the outcome is resolved as No.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden instead of a standard Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are set to close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to cast their vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys regularly indicate that Joe Biden is trailing behind Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error rate, whereas every other Democrat assessed in these hypotheticals is either ahead or within the error margin. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader electorate?

This market will resolve to YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Others)). The result is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Then, will Donald Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot compared to a generic Democrat? The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The answer is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

This question will resolve as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Further details and additional context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Users deemed somewhat reliable are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: GIVEN Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, public, and official, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination for another term. 

Then, is it true that Ted Cruz will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution will be Yes if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention delegates, and No otherwise. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election itself.

Then, is it accurate to say that Ted Cruz will be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The answer will be Yes if Ted Cruz is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and No if he is not. It is irrelevant who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the election.

question.title: If Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This means there is room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the Republican nominee for the 2024 election. It resolves as No for any other outcome.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden fail to publicly declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination, will Ted Cruz become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden does not make a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This implies that there remains a possibility for Biden to accept the nomination.

In light of this, will Ted Cruz be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The answer is Yes if Ted Cruz is picked by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the Republican nominee for the 2024 election. It is No for any other result.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might take place after the specified date. It specifically addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump remains on the primary ballot without being disqualified under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This status is verified through formal announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal records, or trustworthy news sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements are excluded. 

Then, will Biden resign from the race or be otherwise incapacitated from continuing before July 20, at midnight Eastern Time?

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the US Core CPI will rise over 0.1% from June to July?
para_P.body:
The answer will be YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase exceeding 0.1% when compared to June 2024.

The data used for resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will rely on the precise (not rounded) figure.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially announce that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and enable the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Given this situation, will the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: If Biden is declared unable to fulfill his duties under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August, will the US Core CPI show a Month-over-Month rise exceeding 0.1% in July?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is incapable of executing the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Under these circumstances, will the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 rise by more than 0.1% in comparison to June 2024? The resolution will be based on data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) value.

question.title: Given Biden is not declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this condition. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context for the condition: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

Then, is the following true? The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

para_P.title: If Biden is not officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, will the US Core CPI experience a Month-over-Month rise exceeding 0.1% in July?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) do not activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and thereby allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this stipulation. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context for this stipulation: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

Then, is the following accurate? The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% in comparison to June 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves as YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% relative to June 2024, based on the exact (not rounded) figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or neither of them (NO)?
question.body:
The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

comment if you have any questions or news 💙

para_P.title: Will the running mate chosen by Kamala Harris be either Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or someone else entirely (NO)?
para_P.body:
Currently, the leading candidates for Kamala's vice presidential selection are Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. Reports indicate that Kamala will make her decision prior to August 7th.

This market will conclude with a YES if Kamala Harris publicly announces her choice of running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

Conversely, the market will conclude with a NO if Kamala Harris reveals a different individual as her running mate.

I will await Kamala's official confirmation of her selection to finalize this.

Then, can we assert the following? Kamala Harris will declare her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. This is a YES if Kamala Harris confirms her selection as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro prior to August 7th. It is a NO if she chooses anyone else as her running mate.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Ireland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ireland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Ireland fails to qualify, the inquiry will resolve with a **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Ireland qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland qualify for the Grand Final?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:
1. Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
2. Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

If Ireland does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A. If Ireland qualifies but Poland does not, the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Assuming Ireland makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland also reach the Grand Final?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:
1. Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
2. Poland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

If Ireland fails to qualify, the question will be deemed N/A. If Ireland qualifies but Poland does not, the question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: If Ireland fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Ireland does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, meaning they participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified. Then, will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Should Ireland not make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Poland secure a spot?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Ireland does not make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, which means they take part in a Semi-final and are officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not qualifying. In that case, will Poland secure a position in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?

The outcome will be determined as **Yes** if Poland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

para_P.title: Is it possible for Scotland to conduct an official, authorized referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if a referendum concerning Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom takes place in Scotland before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be an "advisory" referendum, meaning it does not need to possess any legal binding authority.

A referendum will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style referendum where permission for the vote has been denied by the UK government, nor by a vote organized by civil society groups. It is essential that the referendum has the approval of the London government.

The referendum must receive the approval of the London government and cannot be classified as a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style referendum. It resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: Will Russia gain authority over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) displays the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E classified under any of the following categories:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Previous 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian control of the site



The inquiry will be deemed **No** if the site is not classified under any of the categories that suggest Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Previous 24 Hours

- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any additional categories established by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the site or a lack of Russian control of the site

question.title: Given Russia controls Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories indicating Russian control.

Then, is it true that prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 cycle? The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, is it accurate to say that before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign will issue a clear, public, official statement declaring that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election? This announcement must be explicit and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the nomination.

question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Inflection will release a report detailing the findings from an external red-team evaluation of their models' safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Inflection, this inquiry will be considered **YES** if they make available a *public* report by June 30, 2024, which includes the outcomes from an *external* entity assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the public in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "accessible to the public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require a payment). If it is not accessible in some EU nations (like Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" in this context refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The outcome will still be positive even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Conditional on ChatGPT being generally available in the EU by June 30, 2024, will Inflection publish a report on external red-teaming of their models for safety by the same date?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be adequate.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.
