question.title: [Metaculus] Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than th..."The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25850/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if the domestic box office opening for the Deadpool & Wolverine reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for Deadpool (2016) and The Wolverine (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value surpass that of Apple on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be affirmed as Yes if, on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, based on Companies Market Cap, when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump be disqualified or barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The question will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the outlined conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves affirmatively.

Then, on July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's? This resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Francis Suarez going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently being discussed; additional candidates may emerge later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a better probability of winning than Joe Biden according to the same FiveThirtyEight forecast. Should both candidates have equal chances, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The resolution will be determined using FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any changes in FiveThirtyEight's forecasting methods will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It may not resolve until the July 20 data becomes available. If data for July 19 is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest prior figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The total number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be taken into account.

question.title: Conditional on 538 projecting Biden as the favorite on July 19, will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast. This is determined by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's website for that date. Then, is Francis Suarez selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Suarez is selected as the nominee by the convention delegates, and No otherwise.

para_P.body: Let’s consider this scenario: On July 19, 2024, FiveThirtyEight forecasts that Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the blue and red trend lines displayed on their website for that date. In this case, will Francis Suarez be nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The answer is Yes if the convention delegates select Suarez as their nominee, and No if they do not.

question.title: GIVEN 538 projects Trump as the favorite on July 19, will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast. This is based on the odds indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically for July 19, and will be resolved as soon as data for July 20 becomes available. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, the nearest previous figures will be used.

Then, is it true that Francis Suarez will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Suarez is selected as the nominee, and NO if any other candidate is selected. This decision is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: IF 538 indicates Trump as the leading candidate on July 19, will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: On July 19, 2024, the FiveThirtyEight election forecast shows Donald Trump having a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Joe Biden, as reflected in the blue and red trend lines for that date. This will be determined once data for July 20 is released. In the absence of data for July 19 by July 22, the closest earlier data will be utilized.

Then, can we conclude that Francis Suarez will be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The answer is YES if Suarez is appointed as the candidate, and NO if another individual is chosen. This outcome relies solely on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if they fail to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Serbia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Serbia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other nations, the question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Given Serbia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta also qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria: For Malta, this resolves as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Malta does not qualify, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If Serbia secures a spot in the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024, will Malta achieve the same?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Serbia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta also secure a place in the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria: For Malta, this resolves as **Yes** if Malta competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the EBU as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Malta does not qualify, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given that Serbia fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta qualify?
question.body:
This question addresses two separate outcomes for the Eurovision 2024 contest.

Condition: Serbia must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having failed to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Outcome: Malta must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for this to resolve as **Yes**. If Malta does not qualify, it resolves as **No**.

If the condition regarding Serbia is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Serbia does not make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, can Malta secure a spot?
para_P.body:
This inquiry concerns two distinct results for the Eurovision 2024 event.

Prerequisite: Serbia needs to compete in a Semi-final and be officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Result: Malta must also compete in a Semi-final and be officially confirmed by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for this to conclude as **Yes**. If Malta fails to qualify, it concludes as **No**.

If the prerequisite regarding Serbia is not satisfied, the question concludes as N/A.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if just a single ballot is needed, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any moment before midnight Central Time on July 20, it is evident that there are 10 or more Democratic Senators, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Given 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before midnight July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out, as shown on the New York Times interactive election page. Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? 

Resolution criteria:
- Condition: Resolves YES if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive election page shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, resolves NO.
- Outcome: Resolves YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Resolves NO if only one ballot is required.

para_P.title: If 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw prior to July 20, will there be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: By midnight July 20 Central Time, if 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw, as indicated on the New York Times interactive election page. In that case, will the Democratic Party need to conduct multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? 

Criteria for resolution:
- Condition: Resolves to YES if at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive election page indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are urging Biden to step down. If not, it resolves to NO.
- Outcome: Resolves to YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. It resolves to NO if only a single ballot is necessary.

question.title: Conditional on fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out before July 20, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024. This is determined by the New York Times tracking page, which resolves as 'Yes' if at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out.

Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This question resolves as 'Yes' if more than one round of voting is needed, indicating a brokered convention. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as 'No'.

para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Less than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to step down before July 20, 2024. This is verified by the New York Times tracking page, which concludes as 'Yes' if at no time before midnight July 20 Central Time, it indicates 10 or more Democratic Senators urging Biden to withdraw.

In that case, will the Democratic Party need to conduct multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This question will resolve as 'Yes' if more than one voting round is necessary, signifying a brokered convention. If only a single ballot is required, then this question will resolve as 'No'.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will OpenAI make a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:

- OpenAI makes a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a statement issued by the company or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a quote from an interview). The statement must reflect a new level of commitment to the principle compared to the period when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot simply restate that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus confirms that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact certain signatories or endorsers to evaluate their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a good first step" for this question to be resolved as **Yes**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)This will resolve as YES if the market linked above achieves 377 traders prior to the market's closing time (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve as NO if it does not.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommend that Tesla investors oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation plan or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
para_P.body: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly recommending that Tesla investors vote *against* Elon Musk's remuneration package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. If not, the question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: If ISS advises against Elon Musk's package or Kimbal Musk's re-election, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by July 15?
question.body:
The conditional question is based on two separate forecasting questions:

Condition (P): Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
- Resolves YES if ISS releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Resolves NO otherwise.

Outcome of interest (Q): Will the linked market get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15?
- Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

Conditional Expression: Given that ISS advises against Elon Musk's package or Kimbal Musk's re-election, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15?

para_P.title: Should ISS recommend opposing Elon Musk's compensation package or Kimbal Musk's re-election, will the associated market have no fewer than 377 participants by July 15?
para_P.body:
This conditional inquiry is derived from two distinct forecasting questions:

Condition (P): Will the proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) suggest that Tesla investors vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
- Resolves YES if ISS publishes a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to oppose either Elon Musk's remuneration at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or Kimbal Musk's re-election to the Tesla board. Resolves NO otherwise.

Outcome of interest (Q): Will the associated market have at least 377 participants by the end of July 15?
- Resolves YES if the market mentioned above has 377 participants before it closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

Conditional Expression: Assuming that ISS recommends against Elon Musk's compensation or Kimbal Musk's re-election, will the associated market have at least 377 participants by the end of July 15?

question.title: Given ISS advises for Musk's package and Kimbal's re-election, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by July 15?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not release any statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND does not advise against the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. 

Then, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15? 

Resolution criteria: The question resolves YES if the market embedded at (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If ISS provides no guidance against Musk's compensation and Kimbal's board position, will the associated market reach a minimum of 377 traders by July 15?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not issue any remarks that explicitly recommend Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion remuneration package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder assembly AND does not suggest disapproval of Kimbal Musk's re-election to the Tesla board. 

Then, will the associated market achieve at least 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15? 

Resolution criteria: The question resolves to YES if the market located at (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has 377 traders prior to market closure (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves to NO otherwise.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

para_P.title: Is it expected that 24 or more world records will be set at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry concludes as **Yes** if the total count of world records established during the Paris Olympics meets or exceeds 24.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France finish among the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will have a positive resolution if France secures a position in the top 5 (ties also result in a positive resolution) at the Olympic Games taking place in 2024. It will remain uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The ranking of the medal table is determined by the total number of medals earned by each participating nation, arranged by:

1. Count of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Count of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Count of Bronze Medals.

question.title: Given France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will at least 24 world records be broken?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between France's performance and the breaking of world records at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Suppose the following is true: France places in the top 5 at the Olympics being held in 2024, with the medal table calculated by the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze Medals won. Resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

Then, will at least 24 world records be broken during the Paris Olympics? This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

para_P.title: If France secures a position in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will there be a minimum of 24 world records shattered?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between France's achievements and the establishment of new world records at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Assuming the following holds true: France finishes in the top 5 at the 2024 Olympics, with the medal standings determined by the total count of Gold, Silver, and Bronze Medals achieved. The question remains unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

Consequently, will there be at least 24 world records set during the Paris Olympics? This question is answered with **Yes** if the count of world records set during the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or more.

question.title: Conditional on France failing to place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will at least 24 world records be broken?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where France does not place in the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, which resolves positively if France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve negatively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by the number of Gold Medals, Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals in case of ties.

Given this scenario, the question then asks: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This will resolve as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

para_P.title: If France does not achieve a Top 5 finish at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will there be a minimum of 24 world records set?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which France fails to secure a spot in the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, which is confirmed positively if France does not finish in the top 5 (with ties counted negatively) during the 2024 Olympic Games. The ranking of the countries is determined by the total medals earned by each nation, prioritized by Gold Medals, then Silver Medals, and finally Bronze Medals in the event of ties.

In light of this scenario, the question posed is: Will there be at least 24 world records established during the 2024 Paris Olympics? This will be answered with **Yes** if the number of world records achieved at the Paris Olympics is 24 or more.

question.title: Will Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Norway set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Norway competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Norway fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Switzerland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Switzerland fails to qualify, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: If Switzerland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Norway also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Given this, will Norway also qualify for the Grand Final? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Should Switzerland make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Norway also make the cut?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Switzerland takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In this case, will Norway also secure a spot in the Grand Final? This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Norway competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Norway does not qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Given Switzerland fails to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Norway qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Norway qualify for the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Switzerland does not make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, can Norway advance?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: Switzerland takes part in a Semi-final and the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) officially declares that it has not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, can Norway advance to the Grand Final?

Criteria for determining the outcome: This question will be answered with **Yes** if Norway competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Norway fails to qualify, the question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: Will Russia gain dominance over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) categorizes the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains within the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Authority

- Declared Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other classifications established by ISW that suggest Russian authority over the area



The inquiry will be resolved as **No** if the area is not classified under any of the categories suggesting Russian authority, which includes, but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Advances in the Last 24 Hours

- Declared Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any other classifications created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian authority over the area or a lack of Russian authority over the area

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds by July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that by July 15 he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: If Donald Trump is removed from the primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, excluding speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked, this condition is not met.

Then, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? This resolves as YES if the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control or claimed Russian territory. It resolves as NO if the location is not shown as under Russian control, including categories indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control.

para_P.title: Should Donald Trump be disqualified from the primary election ballot due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Russia possess Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media sources, excluding speculative articles, opinion columns, or unofficial statements. If Trump is disqualified or barred and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred as of July 15th, this condition is not satisfied.

Then, will Russia have authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? This is determined as YES if the ISW map indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as being under Russian control or claimed as Russian territory. It is determined as NO if the area is not depicted as under Russian control, including categories that denote Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian authority.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is not removed from any primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. There are no official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports confirming such a removal or block. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves affirmatively.

Then, is it true that on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location? The question will resolve as **Yes** if the location is in any of these categories indicating Russian control, and **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.title: Assuming Donald Trump remains on all primary election ballots as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Russia have authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially prohibited or removed from the primary election ballots of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. There have been no official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports that indicate such a prohibition or removal. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements do not qualify as sufficient evidence for resolution. This inquiry does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may arise after the specified date. It is solely concerned with whether Donald Trump has not been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated conditions as of July 15, 2024. If he is initially barred from a ballot and then reinstated, such that he is not barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will be answered affirmatively.

Therefore, is it accurate that on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map categorizes the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under any of the following classifications: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any additional categories established by ISW that demonstrate Russian control over the area? The answer will be **Yes** if the location falls into any of these classifications indicating Russian dominance, and **No** if the location is not categorized as under Russian control, which also encompasses but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other classifications created by ISW that signify Ukrainian control or absence of Russian control in the area.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden fall between 2 and 3, based on 538's average of national polls?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when it is reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

para_P.title: Is it possible that a Trump family member will secure the Republican nomination for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves **Yes** if any of the following individuals becomes the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

question.title: Conditional on a member of the Trump family being the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A member of the Trump family, specifically one of the following individuals: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump, is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if one of the specified members of the Trump family is the Republican nominee.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The question resolves **Yes** if the lead is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3, and **No** otherwise.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If a member of the Trump family is the Republican candidate, will Trump's margin over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: A member of the Trump family, specifically one of the following individuals: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump, is the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024. Under these circumstances, will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Criteria for the condition to be met: Resolves **Yes** if one of the designated members of the Trump family is the Republican candidate.

Criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump advantage. The question resolves **Yes** if the margin is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3, and **No** otherwise.

If the condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: If no member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee in 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: No member of the Trump family, including Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump, is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. 

Then is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if none of the listed Trump family members is the Republican nominee.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: In the event that no individual from the Trump family secures the Republican nomination for 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, as per 538?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: None of the Trump family members, which includes Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump, is the Republican nominee for the presidency in 2024. 

Is it then accurate that Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden is greater than 2 but less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538? 

Criteria for determining the condition: Resolves **Yes** if none of the aforementioned Trump family members is the Republican nominee. 
Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if Trump's advantage over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, as referenced by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

question.title: Will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close sub $100 per share by 7/31?
question.body: This market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below 100$ on any day before 7/31.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) to finish below $100 per share before July 31?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a YES if NVDA ends any trading day under $100 prior to July 31.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the US Core CPI will rise above 0.1% from June to July?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 surpasses 0.1% compared to the figure for June 2024.

The data used for this determination will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will rely on the precise (not rounded) value.

question.title: Conditional on the US Core CPI increasing by more than 0.1% in July, will Nvidia close below $100 per share by 7/31?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, and Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 on any day before 7/31/2024. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The Data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: The market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below $100 on any day before 7/31/2024.

para_P.title: Assuming the US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% in July, will Nvidia's stock price drop below $100 per share by the end of July?
para_P.body:

Criteria for determining the outcome: The market will be deemed TRUE if NVDA trades below $100 on any date before 7/31/2024.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.body:

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he achieve a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to vote with Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a standard Democrat on a theoretical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat hypothetically assessed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold participants indicative of the broader population?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater when both polls end.

The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if this calculation for the first poll minus the calculation for the second poll is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the closing time, regardless of circumstances.

Assuming the condition holds true: Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Biden rather than a generic Democrat. Then, will Donald Trump Jr. be the chosen Republican nominee for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?

- For the second condition: Resolves YES if Donald Trump Jr. is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved by examining the lead of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value showed Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is reported as greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. This is accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this measure, a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Given this condition, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is selected as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and No otherwise.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden is more than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, will Ted Cruz emerge as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is reported to have a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average for the upcoming presidential election. This information is retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump.

Under this scenario, will Ted Cruz be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will be considered a Yes if Ted Cruz is appointed as the nominee by the Republican National Convention delegates, and a No otherwise.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is <= 3 or > 4 on July 15, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for that date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead and a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

Then, is it true that Ted Cruz will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will resolve as Yes if Ted Cruz is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the election day.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden is either 3 or less, or more than 4, will Ted Cruz be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following condition holds: On July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden is either at most 3 or exceeds 4. This is based on the data shown on the chart for that date, which was accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, where a positive number signifies a Trump lead and a negative number signifies a Biden lead.

Then, can we conclude that Ted Cruz will be nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will be considered Yes if Ted Cruz is nominated by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who ultimately runs on election day.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Google DeepMind will release a report detailing the findings from an external safety red-team evaluation of their models by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question will be considered **YES** if they release a *public* report by June 30, 2024, which includes the findings from an *external* entity assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible within the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
The question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Widely accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without employing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in some EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers specifically to the general web interface (not the API) used for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it, even if unavailable in certain countries or to specific groups like minors. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively if the service is substantially the same even if the name or website has changed.

Then, is it true that Google DeepMind will publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

para_P.title: With the general availability of ChatGPT in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind release a report on external red-teaming by that date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is to access it without needing a VPN, potentially requiring payment, and that over 50% of the population can utilize it, even if it is not available in some countries or for certain groups such as minors. The term "ChatGPT" refers to the overall web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it is considered positively if the service remains largely unchanged, despite any alterations in name or website.

Thus, is it accurate to say that Google DeepMind will issue a public report detailing the findings from an external party assessing the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI's ChatGPT not being generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind publish a report with external red-teaming results by then?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is not generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Not generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

Then, is it true that Google DeepMind will publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024? For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: If OpenAI's ChatGPT is not broadly accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind release a report detailing external red-teaming findings by that date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following condition holds: OpenAI's ChatGPT is not broadly accessible to individuals in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Not broadly accessible" indicates that the typical situation for people in the EU is that they cannot utilize it without a VPN (which may involve a fee). If it is inaccessible in specific EU nations (as occurred in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to, for instance, minors, this will be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population cannot access it. Here, "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It still resolves positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

Thus, is it accurate to say that Google DeepMind will issue a report containing outcomes from external red-teaming of their models concerning safety by June 30, 2024? For Google DeepMind, this question is answered with YES if, by June 30, 2024, they release a public report with the findings from an external entity evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.
