question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the advantage Donald Trump holds over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead by 2.4 points, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview on camera for over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview was Biden's session on The Howard Stern Show in April, during which he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden engages in another such face-to-face interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will conclude with a YES. If no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, the outcome will be a NO. 

This market does not account for press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video could potentially only showcase 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus it would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest spot on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes have each included less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: If Joe Biden has an in-person interview on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but includes appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Resolution criteria for this condition: The market resolves YES if such an interview occurs before the end of July 2024, and NO if no qualifying interview is released by then.

Given this condition, the question is whether Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average as reported on the chart for that date. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. The value will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden have a face-to-face interview captured on video lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but be 3 or less on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Imagine that Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera for no less than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but does encompass appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes, as long as there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person.

The criteria for resolving this condition are as follows: The market will determine YES if such an interview takes place before the end of July 2024, and NO if no qualifying interview is made available by that time.

Based on this condition, the inquiry is whether Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538 as displayed on the chart for that date. A positive figure reflects a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure indicates a Biden lead. This value will be verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: If Joe Biden does not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose Joe Biden does not have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this condition is not met. The condition excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls. It includes appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, but there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Given this condition, will Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This question will resolve based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden fail to participate in an in-person interview or discussion on camera lasting more than 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden be greater than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming Joe Biden does not engage in an in-person interview or discussion on camera for a minimum of 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The last relevant interview was Biden's session on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. If Biden takes part in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this condition will not be satisfied. The stipulation excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls. It does include guest appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview that is edited into a program like 60 Minutes, but there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person.

Given this stipulation, will Trump's margin over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for that date shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

Otherwise, resolves NO.

Suppose this is true. Then, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? 

The question resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before the specified time. Otherwise, it resolves NO. If the condition regarding the Secret Service head is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Kimberly Cheatle, the head of the U.S. Secret Service, does not step down in the next three months, will Joe Biden pass away prior to Saturday?

Is it the case that Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will continue her role without resigning, being dismissed, or any other reason, until October 12, 2024? 

If this holds true, will there be an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th? 

The answer is YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before the designated time. If not, the answer is NO. If the condition regarding the head of the Secret Service is not satisfied, the question is considered N/A.

question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is a terrorist incident expected to take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the Opening Ceremony date (26 July 2024) to the Closing Ceremony date (11 August 2024). The response will be negative if the aforementioned scenario does not occur.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or any member of the Council of Ministers of France.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring or killing at least one person other than the terrorist(s) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. The event is described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi? If the ICC issues such a warrant before July 1, 2024, the question resolves as Yes. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If a terrorist incident takes place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the ICC release arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following scenario holds true: A terrorist incident occurs in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, resulting in injury or death to at least one individual other than the terrorist(s) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. The event is classified as a 'terrorist incident' by any French state authority, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it accurate to say that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) will issue an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli government officials: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi? If the ICC does issue such a warrant before July 1, 2024, the answer is Yes. If not, the answer is No.

If the condition is not satisfied, the answer will be N/A.

question.title: Conditional on no terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: No terrorist attack in metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will the International Criminal Court (ICC) issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members before July 1, 2024?

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If no terrorist incidents take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the ICC release arrest warrants for the specified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: There are no terrorist incidents in metropolitan France that result in injuries or fatalities to anyone other than the perpetrators, from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) through to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). A 'terrorist incident' is defined as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or any member of the Council of Ministers of France.

In that case, will the International Criminal Court (ICC) issue arrest warrants for any of the following Israeli government officials before July 1, 2024?

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

The resolution will be YES if the ICC issues an arrest warrant for any of the mentioned Israeli officials before July 1, 2024. It will be NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if they fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Slovenia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Slovenia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if it fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Slovenia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta also qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for Malta: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Slovenia secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Malta do the same?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Slovenia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Malta also make it to the Grand Final? 

Criteria for Malta's qualification: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Malta competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Malta does not qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Slovenia failing to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? If Malta qualifies, the question resolves as **Yes**. If Malta does not qualify, the question resolves as **No**. If Slovenia does not fail to qualify, the condition is not met.

para_P.title: If Slovenia does not make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, can Malta secure a spot?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Slovenia takes part in a Semi-final and is declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not advancing to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta compete in a Semi-final and be declared by the EBU as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? If Malta advances, the answer is **Yes**. If Malta does not advance, the answer is **No**. If Slovenia qualifies, the premise is not satisfied.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Chris Christie going to be the GOP candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the US. Any other candidates will result in a **No** outcome. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the date of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on the selection made by the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Conditional on Chris Christie being the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Given this scenario, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024? This is based on the chart reported by 538 on July 15, 2024, and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: If Chris Christie is the Republican nominee, will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 but be at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, a decision made solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

In this context, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election surpass 3 and be no more than 4 on July 15, 2024? This is based on the data reported by 538 on July 15, 2024, and reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump.

question.title: Given Chris Christie is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that any other candidate is selected, and it is not relevant who receives the nomination on the election day, only who is selected by the convention delegates.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024? This will resolve based on 538's reported national polling average for that date, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: If Chris Christie does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming this scenario holds: Chris Christie is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This implies that another candidate will be nominated, and it does not matter who is nominated on election day, but rather who is chosen by the delegates of the convention.

Then, can we confirm that Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 3 and is no more than 4 on July 15, 2024? This will be determined based on the national polling average reported by 538 for that date, as retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA political group secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be considered **No** for all other results. In the event of a tie in seats between two groups, both sub-questions will be resolved as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and with a **No** for all other political factions. In the event of a tie between two groups for the number of seats, both will be considered a **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media coverage.

question.title: Conditional on GUE/NGL holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Greens–EFA also hold the most seats?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group also holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If both GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA are tied for the most seats, this question resolves as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Assuming GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will the Greens–EFA political group also secure the highest number of seats?
para_P.body: Let us consider the following scenario: GUE/NGL has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA group also possesses the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. In the event that both GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA are tied for the highest number of seats, this inquiry will also be answered with **Yes**. The resolution of this inquiry will depend on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

question.title: Given GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats, will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This means that GUE/NGL either has fewer seats than the group with the most seats or is not tied for the most seats. Now, under this condition, will the Greens–EFA political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria:
1. For the condition (GUE/NGL not holding the most seats): This resolves as **Yes** if GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats. If GUE/NGL holds the most seats or is tied for the most, it resolves as **No**.
2. For the outcome (Greens–EFA holding the most seats): This resolves as **Yes** if Greens–EFA holds the most seats and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for the most seats, both are considered to hold the most seats.

Both criteria are based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: If GUE/NGL does not possess the highest number of seats, will the Greens–EFA emerge with the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: GUE/NGL does not possess the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This indicates that GUE/NGL either has fewer seats than the party with the highest count or is not in a tie for the highest number of seats. Given this situation, will the Greens–EFA political group have the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria:
1. For the condition (GUE/NGL not holding the most seats): This resolves as **Yes** if GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats. If GUE/NGL holds the most seats or is tied for the most, it resolves as **No**.
2. For the outcome (Greens–EFA holding the most seats): This resolves as **Yes** if Greens–EFA holds the most seats and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for the most seats, both are considered to hold the most seats.

Both criteria are based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight classify Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a superior probability of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that same date. In the event that both candidates are viewed as equally likely to win, the market will split 50-50.

The resolution will be determined using FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures shown by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any alterations in the method by which FiveThirtyEight derives its statistics will not influence the outcome of this market.

This market will reach a conclusion based on the data for July 19 as soon as information for July 20 is made available. It is possible that this market may not resolve until the datapoints for July 20 are accessible. Should there be no data available for July 19 by July 22 at 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Given 538 Projects Biden as the favorite on Friday, will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: FiveThirtyEight projects Joe Biden as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump on July 19, 2024. This is determined by the FiveThirtyEight election forecast numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for that date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this is considered a 50-50 resolution. The resolution is based on the July 19 data as soon as July 20 data becomes available, or the nearest previous data if July 19 data is unavailable by July 22, 11:59 PM ET.

Given this scenario, will Tim Scott be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who receives the nomination on election day.

para_P.title: With 538 indicating Biden as the frontrunner on Friday, is Tim Scott set to be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: FiveThirtyEight predicts Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump on July 19, 2024. The determination is based on the data from July 19, and will be updated as soon as data from July 20 is available, or the closest prior data if July 19 information is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET.

In light of this situation, will Tim Scott be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The conclusion is reliant on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is nominated on election day.

question.title: If 538 projects Trump as the favorite on July 19, will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast. Then, is it true that Tim Scott will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for P: This resolves to “Yes” if Trump is projected as the favorite on July 19, 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast. If Biden is projected as the favorite, it resolves to “No”. If the odds are equal, it resolves 50-50.

Resolution criteria for Q: This resolves to “Yes” if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Otherwise, it resolves to “No.”

para_P.title: Should Trump be seen as the frontrunner on July 19, will Tim Scott be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following condition holds: On July 19, 2024, the FiveThirtyEight election forecast indicates that Donald Trump has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Joe Biden. In that case, can we conclude that Tim Scott will be nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for P: This resolves to “Yes” if Trump is indicated as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024, per FiveThirtyEight's election forecast. If Biden is indicated as the frontrunner, it resolves to “No”. If the probabilities are equal, it resolves 50-50.

Resolution criteria for Q: This resolves to “Yes” if Tim Scott is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Otherwise, it resolves to “No.”

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony during the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial, will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Donald Trump must testify at the trial, either in person or remotely, as reported by credible sources.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Will Hurd must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. The selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

para_P.title: Will a single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:

- soccer

- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have triumphed in at least two of these competitions for the question to resolve as **Yes**.

The resolution of the question can occur as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios is taking place (for instance, if neither team contesting the final of the last event has won any of the others).

The condition (P) is that at the 2024 Paris Olympics, the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in at least two of the following women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If women's teams from eight different NOCs win gold in these sports, the condition is not met.

The outcome (Q) is that an athlete wins at least two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Resolution: If the condition is met, resolve **Yes** if the outcome is true; resolve **No** if the outcome is false. If the condition is not met, resolve as N/A.

If women's teams from eight distinct NOCs are awarded gold in these sports, the prerequisite is not satisfied.

The result (Q) is that a competitor secures at least two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Conclusion: If the prerequisite is fulfilled, conclude **Yes** if the result is true; conclude **No** if the result is false. If the prerequisite is not fulfilled, conclude as N/A.

Condition: No nation wins more than one women's team sport. Outcome: An athlete winning more than one medal for tennis. This resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

If the condition is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

Stipulation: No country secures victories in more than one women's team sport. question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be resolved as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A Republican lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will he be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement is unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, is it true that before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Should Biden state that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will he be deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration that he will neither seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement is unequivocal and final, eliminating any possibility that Biden might accept the nomination.

Then, is it accurate to say that before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially proclaim that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President?

Note: The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is not applicable.

question.title: If Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will he be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This means there is no unambiguous and conclusive statement leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden fail to declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will he be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden does not provide a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election cycle. This implies that there is no clear and definitive announcement, leaving open the possibility that Biden might still accept the nomination.

In that case, will the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The length of the incapacity is not relevant for this inquiry. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's use of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not considered.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains collaborate with the National Rally for the 2024 elections in France?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if an official coalition or electoral partnership is declared between Les Républicains and the National Rally prior to June 30, 2024, based on information from [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). Conversely, if no such partnership is made public, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Is the Prime Minister of France a member of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Prime Minister of France's party is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Given the Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024, will the Republicans Party form an alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024, according to credible sources. Then, will the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the 2024 French legislative election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as Yes if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party and National Rally for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as No.

para_P.title: Assuming the Prime Minister of France is affiliated with the Together coalition on July 30, 2024, will the Republicans Party collaborate with the National Rally for the 2024 legislative elections in France?
para_P.body:
Let us consider this scenario: The Prime Minister of France is part of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024, based on reliable information. In that case, will the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) establish a political partnership with the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the 2024 French legislative elections?

Criteria for determining the condition: It is considered true if the Prime Minister of France is with Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time.

Criteria for determining the outcome: It is considered true if an electoral alliance or coalition agreement between the Republicans Party and National Rally is officially declared before June 30, 2024, as per credible sources. If such an agreement is not made, this question is resolved as No.

question.title: Given the Prime Minister of France does not belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024, will the Republicans Party form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The party of the Prime Minister of France is not Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. Then, will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: If the Prime Minister of France is not part of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024, will the Republicans Party collaborate with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statement is accurate: The Prime Minister of France's party is not associated with Together on July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable information. Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) establish a political partnership with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?

Criteria for determining the outcome: This will be considered **Yes** if, prior to June 30, 2024, an official announcement of an electoral partnership or coalition agreement between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming French legislative election is made, according to credible sources. If no such announcement occurs, this question will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to rapidly nominate Biden?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party's initiative to expedite President Joe Biden's nomination, claiming it suppresses the ongoing critical discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump, revealing that many of their members are significantly concerned about the future of Biden's candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a clever way to stifle debate and I suppose through sheer force, create unity, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He chose not to confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will conclude with a YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

Even if multiple letters collectively have 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would also suffice to resolve this market to YES.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market closing time, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Given a brokered Democratic convention in 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Then, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.
