Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: In the event of a brokered Democratic convention in 2024, will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Assuming that the Democratic Party needs more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter opposing the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule?

Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their dissent against their party’s move to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the vital ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO signals the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and presumably through sheer force, attain unity, but that’s not how it functions,” Huffman expressed in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of the letter.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who are part of the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. A collection of such letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. If these specifications are not fulfilled by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Given Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Then, will at least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

Resolution criteria: This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Assuming there is no brokered convention for Democrats in 2024, will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: The Democratic Party only needs a single round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. In that case, will at least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden early?

According to context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their disapproval of their party's attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, arguing that it suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

Huffman remarked in an interview, “This is a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to constrain debate and somehow achieve unity through sheer force, but that’s not how it operates.” He opted not to confirm whether the letter exists.

Resolution criteria: This will be marked YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will the likelihood of Kamala winning rise in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the probability of Harris in the Electoral College according to Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be a NO in all other cases.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This occurs if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to this effect, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: If Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's chances of victory rise based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario is accurate: Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This happens if Biden or his campaign issues a clear, official statement to this effect, eliminating any possibility of him accepting the nomination.

In that case, can we say that Kamala Harris's chances of winning improve in the week following this announcement according to Nate Silver's analysis? This will be considered TRUE if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It will be considered FALSE otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Given Joe Biden does not announce he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination, will Kamala's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. Given this, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves YES if Joe Biden or his campaign does not make such an announcement by the specified time. Resolves NO if such an announcement is made.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden refrains from declaring that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination, will Kamala's chances of victory rise according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden does not issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. Given this scenario, will Kamala Harris's chances of winning improve over the upcoming week according to Nate Silver's analysis?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves YES if Joe Biden or his campaign does not make such a statement by the specified time. Resolves NO if such a statement is made.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden fall between 3 and 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential race](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure denotes a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Larry Elder be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Larry Elder is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently recognized; additional options may be included later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Larry Elder being the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that Larry Elder is the official Republican candidate chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other candidates or the eventual nominee on the election day.

Given this, we want to know if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024. This is determined by the value reported on 538's chart for July 15, 2024, accessed on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Larry Elder must be selected as the Republican nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: The polling average must show Trump leading Biden by more than 3 but not more than 4 points on July 15, 2024. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Larry Elder is the Republican candidate, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the scenario where Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This indicates that Larry Elder has been officially selected as the Republican nominee by the delegates, irrespective of any other candidates or the ultimate nominee on election day.

In light of this, we seek to determine whether Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024. This will be ascertained from the data published on 538's chart for that date, which will be reviewed on July 17, 2024. A positive figure reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative figure denotes a lead for Biden.

Criteria for the condition: Larry Elder must be appointed as the Republican nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
Criteria for the outcome: The polling average needs to indicate that Trump is leading Biden by more than 3 but no more than 4 points on July 15, 2024. If the condition is not satisfied, the outcome will be N/A.

question.title: Given Larry Elder is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any other candidate is selected as the Republican nominee.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024? This will be determined based on 538's national polling average as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: Assuming Larry Elder does not become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 and be at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the scenario where Larry Elder is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This implies that another individual will be the Republican nominee.

In this case, can we assert that Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024? This will be evaluated based on 538's national polling average as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure denotes a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies a Biden lead.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Will a Woman be the Democratic Presidential Candidate for 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be deemed “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential candidate for the 2024 election.

This will be deemed “no” if the Democratic delegates choose a man as their presidential candidate for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a single country to secure victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, if the same NOC claims victory in at least two of these competitions, then the answer will be **Yes**.

question.title: Conditional on the same nation winning more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two seemingly unrelated events:

1. The same nation winning more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. This condition resolves as Yes if the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in at least two of the following eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. It resolves as No if women's teams from eight different NOCs win gold in these sports.

2. The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee being a woman. This outcome resolves as Yes if the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and No if they select a male nominee.

Suppose the following is true: The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. Then, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a woman?

para_P.title: If a single country secures victories in multiple women's team events at the 2024 Olympics, will the Democratic nominee for President in 2024 be a female?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the connection between two seemingly unrelated occurrences:

1. A single country achieving triumphs in more than one women's team event at the 2024 Olympics. This condition is considered Yes if the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) claims gold in at least two of the following eight team events: soccer, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. It is deemed No if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs win gold in these events.

2. The Democratic nominee for President in 2024 being a female. This result is Yes if the Democratic delegates choose a woman as the presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and No if they opt for a male nominee.

Assuming the following holds true: A single country secures victories in multiple women's team events at the 2024 Olympics. Then, will the Democratic nominee for President in 2024 be a female?

This question explores the potential correlation between two seemingly unrelated events. 

Suppose the following is true: No nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. This means that women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Then, is it true that the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election? The question resolves “yes” if/when a female nominee is selected, and “no” if/when a male nominee is selected.

para_P.title: Assuming no country secures victory in more than one women's team event at the 2024 Olympics, will the Democratic Party's candidate for President in 2024 be a woman?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the possible link between two events that appear to be unrelated. 

Let us assume the following holds true: No country achieves more than one win in women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics. This implies that women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) claim gold medals in the eight team events: soccer, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Under these circumstances, is it the case that the Democratic delegates will choose a woman as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election? The answer is “yes” if a female nominee is chosen, and “no” if a male nominee is selected.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be greater than 2 but not exceed 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, translating to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is incapable of performing the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances is not included. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 consider Biden the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden on that same date. If both candidates are shown to have equal chances, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The resolution will be determined by FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically using the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any changes in FiveThirtyEight's methodology for calculating these figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. If the July 19 data is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest previous data to July 19.

Please note that the resolution pertains to the probability of each candidate winning, expressed as a number out of 100 rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Given FiveThirtyEight projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is projected as the favorite to win the US presidential election over Donald Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast for July 19, 2024. This means that Biden has a higher probability of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's blue and red trend lines for that date. If no data is available for July 19, the nearest previous figures will be used.

Then, is it true that before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," thus causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President? This does not include Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. The duration of incapacity does not matter for this question.

para_P.title: With FiveThirtyEight indicating Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, will he be declared incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:

This suggests that Biden has a greater likelihood of winning compared to Trump based on FiveThirtyEight's blue and red trend lines for that date. If there are no figures available for July 19, the closest preceding data will be utilized.

Then, is it accurate to state that before August 2024, the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) will invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office," thereby allowing the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President? This does not encompass Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, or the invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. The length of incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

question.title: If 538 projects Biden as not the favorite on July 19, will he be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast. This is determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast for that date, with the resolution based on the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used.

Then, is it true that before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President? The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment, does not count.

para_P.title: Should 538 indicate Biden is not the frontrunner on July 19, will he be officially deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: On July 19, 2024, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast, Donald Trump is more likely to win the US presidential election than Joe Biden. This conclusion is based on the data represented by the blue and red trend lines in FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast for that date, with the assessment grounded in the winning odds for each candidate expressed as a number out of 100 rounded to one decimal place. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the closest earlier figures to July 19 will be utilized.

In that case, is it accurate to say that before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) will invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President? The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment, does not apply.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote for a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys repeatedly indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed hypothetically is either ahead or within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the broader public's views?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the outcome is NO.

These polls and this inquiry will never resolve to N/A and will stay open until their designated closing time.

question.title: If Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

Resolution criteria for P: The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for the poll with Joe Biden - the formula for the poll with a generic Democrat >= 0.03.

Then, is it true that a member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if one of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

In detail, Trump's vote percentage in the poll featuring Joe Biden surpasses that of the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or greater. 

Criteria for assessing P: The calculation for Trump’s vote share is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the calculation for the poll with Joe Biden and the calculation for the poll with a generic Democrat is at least 0.03. 

Consequently, is it accurate to say that a member of the Trump family will be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024? 

Criteria for evaluating Q: Resolves to YES if any of the following individuals is the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump. If not, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters totaling 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and, through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to confirm the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by fewer than 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of fewer than 20 signatures from lawmakers would also suffice for this market to resolve to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the close of the market, it will resolve to NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This market will resolve to YES if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States. It will resolve to NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden according to the same forecast for that date. In the event that both candidates are assigned equal probabilities, the market will resolve 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology that FiveThirtyEight employs to calculate its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will reach a conclusion based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is obtained. It may remain unresolved until the July 20 data is available. If data for July 19 is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the odds of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate won will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States. Any other contenders will result in a **No** answer. This question may take into account any new candidates that may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Under this premise, will the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, surpass 75,000 and not exceed 77,000? The closing figure will be according to Yahoo Finance for that specific date.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony in the hush money case?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, during the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Iran take military action before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will settle on "Yes" if Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries from July 30 until August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will settle on "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military operation" refers to any act of force carried out by Iran on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons storage facility on Israeli territory, the market will settle on "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of reliable reports. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyberattacks, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered for the resolution of this market.

Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian territory, will be counted for the resolution of this market. Attacks against Israel by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah or the Houthis) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Conditional on Iran initiating a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this scenario, a "military action" is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, will count. Attacks by proxy forces will not count.

Then, given this situation, will credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels?

para_P.title: If Iran were to launch a military operation against Israeli territory prior to August 13, 2024, would Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Iran carries out a military operation on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, by 11:59 PM ET. For this context, a "military operation" is characterized as any forceful action undertaken by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime zones that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or by a consensus of reliable reports. This encompasses aerial bombardments, naval assaults, or ground invasions, but does not include cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers. Only actions that are clearly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, will be considered. Attacks conducted by proxy groups will not be included.

In light of this scenario, will reputable sources indicate that Donald Trump has testified, either in person or via remote means, at the trial related to the "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels?

question.title: Conditional on no Iranian military response before August 13th, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
This question considers two separate conditions:

1. **Condition**: No Iranian military response before August 13th, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. This is determined by whether Iran initiates any military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Military action includes any use of force such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions that are officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or confirmed by credible sources. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Actions by proxy forces like Hezbollah or Houthis do not count unless explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to originate from Iranian territory.

2. **Outcome**: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial? This resolves as YES if credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, either in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Suppose the first condition is met: No Iranian military response occurs as defined. Then, is the second condition true: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?

para_P.title: If there is no military action from Iran prior to August 13th, will Donald Trump give testimony at the trial regarding hush money?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines two distinct scenarios:

1. **Scenario**: Absence of any Iranian military action before August 13th, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. This is assessed based on whether Iran engages in any military operations on Israeli territory, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Military operations encompass any acts of force such as airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions that are officially recognized by the Iranian government or verified by reliable sources. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures are excluded. Actions taken by proxy groups like Hezbollah or the Houthis are not considered unless they are explicitly attributed to Iran or confirmed to originate from Iranian territory.

2. **Result**: Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial? This is determined as YES if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has testified, either in person or through remote means, at the trial related to the "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

Assuming the first scenario is satisfied: No Iranian military action occurs as defined. Then, is the second scenario valid: Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there any possibility that Donald Trump will be barred or taken off the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred or removed from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The confirmation of the removal or barring must come from official announcements by state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for the resolution.

The answer will be "No" if these criteria are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It exclusively relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and later reinstated, such that as of July 15 he is not barred from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Retain Its Majority Representation from Hungary in the 2024 Elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, after the European Parliament elections in 2024, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest share of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Are new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles expected to be announced by the European Union prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if credible sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the imposition of new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on the EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. Then, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, will the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources?

para_P.title: If the EU declares new tariffs on electric vehicles from China, will Fidesz-KDNP keep its lead in Hungarian representation in the EU in 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming that credible reports indicate the European Union (EU) has imposed new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, will the Fidesz-KDNP alliance obtain a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition after the 2024 European Parliament elections, thus preserving the most significant representation of Hungary in the European Parliament, based on reliable sources?

question.title: Conditional on the EU not announcing new tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The European Union does not announce any new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This means there are no credible reports of such announcements. Then, is it true that Fidesz-KDNP will maintain its plurality in the European Parliament from Hungary in 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves Yes if, before July 5, 2024, there are no credible reports of the EU announcing new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles.
- For the outcome: Resolves Yes if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thus maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament according to credible sources.

para_P.title: If the EU refrains from introducing new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, will Fidesz-KDNP continue to hold the most seats from Hungary in the European Parliament in 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The European Union does not implement any new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024. This implies that there are no reliable reports regarding such announcements. In that case, can we assert that Fidesz-KDNP will preserve its majority representation in the European Parliament from Hungary in 2024?

Criteria for resolution:
- Regarding the condition: Resolves Yes if, before July 5, 2024, there are no reliable reports of the EU imposing new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles.
- Regarding the outcome: Resolves Yes if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance obtains more seats than any other individual party or coalition, thereby retaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament as per credible sources.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Denmark qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Denmark does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Denmark going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Conversely, if Denmark fails to qualify, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Given Denmark qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland also qualify?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, given that Denmark has qualified. If Poland does not qualify, the question resolves as **No**. If Denmark does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Denmark secures a place in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, will Poland secure a place as well?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, provided that Denmark has already qualified. If Poland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**. If Denmark does not qualify, the outcome will be N/A.

question.title: Given Denmark fails to qualify, will Poland qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Poland participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

para_P.title: If Denmark does not make it, can Poland make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds: Denmark takes part in a Semi-final and the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) officially declares that Denmark has not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Poland take part in a Semi-final and be officially declared by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Mike Pence is chosen as the candidate by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States. Any other candidates will be considered **No**. This question is open to other candidates being introduced in the future, beyond those listed at present.

For the purpose of this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 election; the outcome is strictly based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Mike Pence is the Republican nominee, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time? If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before this time, the resolution is yes. Otherwise, the resolution is no.

para_P.title: If Mike Pence becomes the Republican candidate, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Mike Pence is appointed as the Republican candidate by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, independent of who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election.

Then, can we confirm that Joe Biden will either withdraw or be otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20? If Biden does withdraw or is unable to continue the campaign before this deadline, the answer is yes. If not, the answer is no.

question.title: Conditional on Mike Pence not being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any candidate other than Mike Pence is selected, this condition is met. 

The question then asks whether, given this scenario, President Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden drops out before July 20, otherwise resolves NO.
If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Assuming Mike Pence does not become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which Mike Pence is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any individual other than Mike Pence is nominated, this condition is satisfied. 

The question then inquires whether, in light of this situation, President Biden will withdraw or be otherwise unable to continue his campaign before July 20, midnight Eastern Time.

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves YES if Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee. 
Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden withdraws before July 20, otherwise resolves NO. 
If the condition is not fulfilled, resolves N/A.
