para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to additional candidates that may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is strictly based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare his refusal of the Democratic presidential nomination before July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a statement prior to July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves identically to the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official declaration stating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not provided before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Additional details and fine print can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users deemed reasonably trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market beforehand if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for early resolution requests or to report any issues.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this, will Will Hurd be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Will Hurd is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as their nominee.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden declares that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination, will Will Hurd be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement indicating that he will not run for or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for a new term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would take the nomination.

In light of this, will Will Hurd be nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This is considered a Yes if Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as their candidate.

question.title: Given Joe Biden does not announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. This leaves open the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Resolution criteria for this condition: Resolves Yes if no such announcement is made by the deadline, and No if such an announcement is made.

Now, given this condition, will Will Hurd be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as Yes if Will Hurd is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and No otherwise. The resolution is solely determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden fails to declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Will Hurd be the GOP nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden does not issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming election cycle. This scenario leaves the door open for Biden to potentially accept the nomination.

Criteria for resolution of this situation: The outcome is Yes if no such declaration occurs by the specified deadline, and No if such a declaration is made.

Under these circumstances, will Will Hurd be nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This inquiry will resolve as Yes if Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and No in any other case. The resolution is strictly based on the choice made at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

para_P.title: Will the crossover film featuring Deadpool and Wolverine achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film? [surpassing Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]

https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

This would set a record for the largest opening weekend for any R-rated film. In the United States, it is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated launch in history.

"""

[image]The current record for the highest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestically).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will this new film surpass these figures? It appears it might be very close...

It will definitely be shown in more theaters... Deadpool was a tremendous success at its release, and it was somewhat unexpected.

Since BoxOfficeMojo's reporting on international opening weekends can be a bit peculiar -- providing raw figures but aggregating them in an unusual way -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to confirm the opening weekend figures.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine earns more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or an equivalent source) acknowledges it as the record for an R-rated film release

In other words, the BoxOfficeMojo figures should be regarded as unofficial until confirmed by the Hollywood press. The target number we are aiming for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT by OpenAI be accessible to users in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to users in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** in all other cases.

"Accessible" in this context means that the typical situation for individuals in the EU allows them to use it without the need for a VPN (though it may require a subscription). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as was observed in Italy in early 2023), or if it is restricted for certain groups (such as minors), it will still be deemed positive, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered positive even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems powered by Large Language Models).

"ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, even if the name or website has changed, as long as the service is substantially the same.

Then, is it true that the Greens–EFA political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

This is considered YES if the Greens–EFA has the most seats, and NO in all other cases. Situations where there is a tie for the highest number of seats are also classified as YES. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and it resolves positively if the service is substantially the same even if the name or website has changed.

Then, is it true that the Greens–EFA political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA group holds the most seats, and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, it resolves as **Yes**.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 4 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

Criteria for determining the outcome: This will be assessed based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average reported for July 15, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump. The question will be answered affirmatively if the lead is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4, according to the data retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Criteria for assessing the condition: If Kamala Harris is not selected as the Democratic VP, this condition holds true. If she is appointed as VP, this condition is deemed false. The condition can be determined immediately following the nomination.

Criteria for evaluating the outcome: This will be confirmed as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and at most 4 points on July 15, 2024. The figure will be reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party's initiative to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination sooner than initially intended, arguing that it suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO provides the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend's attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues are still quite troubled about the prospects of Biden's candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination proposal is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively bearing 20 lawmakers' signatures are submitted, this will also suffice to resolve the market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, the market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Will any tennis player secure multiple medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any tennis player achieves a minimum of two medals during the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve 21 or More Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will determine a "Yes" outcome if Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) in case the IOC's reporting is not available. If not, the market will conclude with a "No". 

Should it be verified that Individual Neutral Athletes have earned 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Given Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals, will an athlete win >1 medal for tennis at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. This is determined by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. If they are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the condition is met immediately. 

Then, is it true that an athlete will win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This question resolves as Yes if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: If Individual Neutral Athletes secure at least 21 gold medals, will there be a tennis player who wins more than one medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Individual Neutral Athletes achieve a total of 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. This will be verified by the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. If it is confirmed that they have attained 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the requirement is fulfilled immediately. 

Then, can we assert that a tennis player will earn more than one medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This question is answered with Yes if any tennis player wins at least two medals during the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Given Individual Neutral Athletes win ≤20 gold medals at Paris 2024, will an athlete win multiple tennis medals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 20 or fewer gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 20 or fewer gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this condition is immediately true.

Then, is it true that any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This question resolves as Yes if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: If Individual Neutral Athletes secure 20 or fewer gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will any athlete achieve multiple medals in tennis?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: Individual Neutral Athletes together earn 20 or fewer gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The determination will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 20 or fewer gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, this condition is considered true immediately.

Then, is it the case that at least one athlete wins a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This question will be answered as Yes if at least one athlete secures two or more medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden expected to remain president until the end of July?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

question.title: Given Joe Biden is still president by the end of July, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is still officially president at the specified time.
Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden remains president until the close of July, will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. In that case, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is still the official president at the given time.
Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is greater than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: If Joe Biden is not president by the end of July, will Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question explores the scenario where Joe Biden is not the president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. Given this situation, we want to know if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024. The polling average will be accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden not hold the presidency by the conclusion of July, will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden fall between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry considers the situation in which Joe Biden is not the president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. Under these conditions, we seek to determine if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024. The polling average will be evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure reflects a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead. For instance, a value of 2.4 indicates that Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview was Biden's guest spot on The Howard Stern Show in April, during which he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden engages in another such face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will be deemed YES. If no qualifying interview is published prior to the market's closure at the end of July, this market will be deemed NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview that is edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to qualify. A 50-minute video might only contain 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this condition, a positive value means a Trump lead.

Now, given this condition, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview or conversation on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden appears in an in-person interview/conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. It does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. If no such qualifying interview is released before the end of July, this resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden is more than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden participate in an in-person televised interview for 45 minutes or more before July 31, 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election that is greater than 3 and no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, as noted by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

In light of this situation, will Joe Biden engage in an in-person interview or discussion on camera that lasts at least 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024?

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if Biden takes part in an in-person interview/conversation on camera for a minimum of 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are part of a program like 60 Minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person. It excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. If no qualifying interview is made available before the end of July, this will resolve to NO.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is <= 3 or > 4 on July 15, 2024, will Biden have a 45+ minute in-person interview by end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose Trump's lead over Biden is either less than or equal to 3 points, or greater than 4 points, according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024. This is determined by the chart accessed on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates Trump's lead and a negative value indicates Biden's lead.

Given this condition, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? 

For the interview to qualify, it must not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. For context, interviews like Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for ~70 minutes, qualify. If no such interview is released by the end of July, the question resolves NO.

para_P.title: If Trump's advantage over Biden is 3 points or fewer, or exceeds 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Biden conduct a 45+ minute face-to-face interview by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming Trump's advantage over Biden is either at most 3 points or more than 4 points, based on 538's national polling average from July 15, 2024. This is evaluated from the chart reviewed on July 17, 2024, where a positive figure represents Trump's lead and a negative figure signifies Biden's lead.

Under this scenario, will Joe Biden engage in an in-person interview or on-camera discussion lasting a minimum of 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

To be considered valid, the interview must exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest spots on podcasts, late-night talk shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed face-to-face. For reference, Biden's participation on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for around 70 minutes, qualifies. If no such interview is made public by the end of July, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden serve as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden continues to be the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Ron DeSantis going to be the chosen candidate for the Republican party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently recognized; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: If Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Ron DeSantis needs to be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Should Ron DeSantis become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden still hold the presidency at the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Will Biden still be the President of the United States by the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Ron DeSantis must be chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden continues as US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment does not result in a YES resolution.

question.title: Given Ron DeSantis is not the Republican nominee, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question considers two conditions:

1. **Condition**: Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as TRUE if any candidate other than Ron DeSantis is selected as the Republican nominee.

2. **Outcome**: Resolves YES if Biden remains the US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (making his VP the Acting President) does not affect the resolution.

Suppose the condition is true: Ron DeSantis is not the Republican nominee. Then, will the outcome also be true: Will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?

para_P.title: If Ron DeSantis is not the chosen Republican candidate, will Biden still be in office until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines two criteria:

1. **Criterion**: Ron DeSantis is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is deemed TRUE if any individual other than Ron DeSantis is elected as the Republican candidate.

2. **Result**: Resolves to YES if Biden continues to serve as the US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). Resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. It is important to note that a temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (where his Vice President becomes the Acting President) does not influence the outcome.

Assuming the criterion holds true: Ron DeSantis is not the Republican candidate. Then, will the result also hold true: Will Biden continue to be President until the end of July 2024?

Under this premise, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceed 3 and be 4 or less on July 15, 2024? This is according to the data for that date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure denotes a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s move to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than initially intended, which they contend suppresses the crucial ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, as indicated by a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still profoundly concerned about Biden’s candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if just a single ballot is sufficient, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Given the Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two political events within the Democratic Party in the context of the 2024 US presidential election. 

Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, indicating a brokered convention.

Then, is the following also true? At least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden earlier than originally planned, before the market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Resolution criteria: The first condition resolves as YES if a brokered convention occurs as described. The second condition resolves as YES if at least 20 signatures are collected on such a public letter before the specified deadline. If either condition is not met, the respective component resolves NO.

para_P.title: If the Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024, will a minimum of 20 Democratic House and Senate members endorse a public statement against the proposal to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
This inquiry investigates the connection between two political occurrences within the Democratic Party, particularly in relation to the 2024 US presidential election. 

Assuming the following holds true: The Democratic Party necessitates more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, thereby indicating a brokered convention.

Then, can it also be stated that at least 20 House Representatives or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party will endorse a public statement opposing the initiative to virtually nominate President Joe Biden sooner than planned, prior to the market's closure at the end of Sunday, July 21st? 

Resolution criteria: The first condition is considered YES if a brokered convention takes place as outlined. The second condition is deemed YES if a minimum of 20 signatures are obtained on such a public statement before the designated deadline. If either condition fails to be satisfied, the corresponding component is resolved to NO.

question.title: Conditional on Democrats not having a brokered convention in 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, thus not having a brokered convention. Then, is it true that at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party will sign a public letter opposing the plan to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if only one round of voting is required in the Democratic Party's roll call ballot. Resolves NO if more than one ballot is required.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Assuming that there will not be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024, will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members publicly oppose the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:

Under these circumstances, is it accurate to say that at least 20 Democratic House Representatives or Senators will endorse a public letter against the proposal to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than initially planned before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st? 

Criteria for determining the condition: Resolves YES if only one voting round is necessary in the Democratic Party's roll call ballot. Resolves NO if more than one round is needed.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves YES if a public letter against the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Representatives or Senators before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Resolves NO in other cases.

question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body: The question will be answered with **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla investors to vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the board of directors at Tesla. If not, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** answer. This question is not limited to those currently mentioned; additional candidates may emerge in the future.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump Jr. being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
question.body:
Suppose Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Given this, will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting?

Criterion for condition: Resolves YES if Donald Trump Jr. is selected as the Republican nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if ISS releases a statement explicitly advising against Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump Jr. is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will ISS recommend that Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk's compensation package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
para_P.body:
Assuming that Donald Trump Jr. is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) suggest that Tesla shareholders vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting?

Condition for resolution: Resolves YES if Donald Trump Jr. is nominated as the Republican candidate by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. 
Outcome resolution criteria: Resolves YES if ISS issues a statement clearly advising against Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election. Resolves NO in other cases. If the condition is not satisfied, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given Donald Trump Jr. is not the Republican nominee for 2024, will ISS advise against Elon Musk's package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This condition resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If he is selected, it resolves as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Donald Trump Jr. is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will the proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommend that Tesla shareholders vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This condition resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If he is chosen, it resolves as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Kamala Harris, the Vice President, is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will conclude with a "No".

The main source for determining the outcome of this market will be official announcements from the US government, although a consensus from reliable news sources will also be considered.

Resolver

question.title: Conditional on the Los Angeles Clippers winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will the Boston Celtics also win the 2024 NBA Finals?

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to withdraw from the presidential race and step down from office prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will be resigning from his current presidential term. These declarations must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A statement of his plan to do so is adequate to resolve this market.

If not, this market will resolve NO on August 1st.

If the USD is valued at less than 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024, the outcome will be N/A.

question.title: Conditional on USD being worth less than 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will Joe Biden announce he is dropping out and resigning before end of July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: On August 9th, 2024, the USD is worth less than 145 JPY at the close, according to the USD/JPY close listed on Yahoo! Finance. Then, will Joe Biden announce before the end of July 2024, in Pacific Time, both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term? These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office by then. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient.

para_P.title: If the USD closes at a value lower than 145 JPY on August 9th, 2024, will Joe Biden declare his withdrawal and resignation prior to the end of July?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: On August 9th, 2024, the USD's closing value is below 145 JPY, as per the USD/JPY closing rate found on Yahoo! Finance. In that case, will Joe Biden make an announcement before July 31, 2024, in Pacific Time, stating that he is stepping down from his re-election campaign and will resign from his current position, even if he has not officially left office by that date? A declaration of his plan to resign is adequate for this scenario.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Nikki Haley going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other contenders will result in **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enables the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar events does not apply. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This means the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoked Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and caused the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this condition.

We are interested in whether Nikki Haley will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as Yes if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: If Biden is deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August, will Nikki Haley secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: Biden is deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This implies that the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant group) has invoked Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially announce that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and duties of his office" and has led to the Vice President taking on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this condition.

We seek to determine if Nikki Haley will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will be answered affirmatively if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered negatively. This decision is made based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not based on who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.body:

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, will Nikki Haley be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as Yes if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. The resolution is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).
