question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will the International Criminal Court make any arrest warrants for the specified Israeli leaders prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. If not, it will be deemed **No**.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Given the ICC issues arrest warrants for Israeli leaders, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President before August 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

para_P.title: If the ICC issues arrest warrants for leaders of Israel, will Biden be considered unfit under the 25th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the specified Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. In that case, will Biden be deemed unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024?

Criteria for determining the condition: Resolves to YES if the ICC issues an arrest warrant for any of the specified Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024. Resolves to NO otherwise.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves to YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to assert that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President before August 2024. Resolves to NO otherwise.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden triggering Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

question.title: If the ICC does not issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). Given this, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Should the ICC refrain from issuing arrest warrants for identified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024, will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: Prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not release a warrant for the arrest of any of these Israeli government officials: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). In light of this situation, will the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant entity) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)? 

Note: The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is not included.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Iceland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Iceland takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Ireland going to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Ireland takes part in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Ireland fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Ireland qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Iceland also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Iceland also qualify for the Grand Final? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Ireland makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Iceland make it too?
para_P.body: Assuming the following scenario holds: Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) to have advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Iceland also advance to the Grand Final? This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Iceland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Ireland failing to qualify, will Iceland qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Iceland participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

para_P.title: If Ireland does not make it through, will Iceland make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: Imagine this scenario: Ireland competes in a Semi-final and the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) declares that they have not qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In that case, will Iceland also compete in a Semi-final and be declared by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare his withdrawal from the presidential race and his resignation from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he intends to resign, thereby not finishing his current presidential term. Such announcements must occur before the end of July 2024, according to Pacific Time, although he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated the office by that time. A declaration of his intent to resign will be adequate to settle this market.

If this does not occur, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any comments linked to possible witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The question about Donald Trump resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

The question about Joe Biden resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market. Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden declare that he is withdrawing from the presidential race and stepping down from the presidency before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The inquiry regarding Donald Trump is considered **Yes** if he is charged or indicted for any remarks concerning potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. These charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

The question concerning Joe Biden is deemed YES if he publicly states that he is no longer pursuing re-election and that he will resign from his current presidential term. Such announcements must take place before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated office by that date. A declaration of his intention to resign is adequate to resolve this market. If no such announcements are made, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump not being charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce both dropping out of the re-election race and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024. Given this, will Joe Biden announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024? 

Resolution criteria: For the condition, Donald Trump must not be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024. For the outcome, Joe Biden must announce both that he is dropping out of the re-election race and that he will be resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024 (Pacific Time). The announcement is sufficient; formal resignation is not required by that date.

para_P.title: Assuming that Donald Trump is not indicted for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden declare that he is both withdrawing from the re-election campaign and stepping down from the presidency before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider this scenario: Donald Trump does not face charges or indictments regarding any comments tied to possible witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024. In light of this, will Joe Biden make an announcement stating that he is both ceasing his re-election efforts and resigning from his presidential position before the end of July 2024? 

Resolution criteria: The condition requires that Donald Trump must not be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024. The outcome necessitates Joe Biden announcing that he is both withdrawing from the re-election race and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024 (Pacific Time). The announcement itself is sufficient; a formal resignation is not mandated by that date.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden make an announcement prior to July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for the position of President?

This resolves in the same manner as the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as No.

Additional details and fine print can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users who are deemed reliable are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. You can reach out to @jskf to request an early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Chris Christie going to be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Chris Christie is chosen as the candidate by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently in the spotlight; additional candidates may emerge later.

For this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given Chris Christie is the Republican nominee, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to the deadline, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: If Chris Christie becomes the Republican candidate, will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024, that he will refuse the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assuming Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, which is solely decided by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria: This question will be answered as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before the deadline, this question will be answered as No.

question.title: Conditional on Chris Christie not being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, meaning any other candidate is selected. This determination is solely based on the decision of the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Given this condition, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? The resolution criteria for this outcome are as follows:

- The question resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle.
- The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of Biden accepting the nomination.
- If no such announcement is made by the deadline, the question resolves as No.

The resolution of this question will be based on the original Metaculus question, and once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied here.

para_P.title: Assuming that Chris Christie does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden make a declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Chris Christie is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, indicating that another individual is selected. This conclusion is based solely on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Under this scenario, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President? The criteria for determining this outcome are as follows:

- The question will be answered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.
- The statement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility of Biden accepting the nomination.
- If no such declaration is made by the specified deadline, the question will be answered No.

The resolution of this question will rely on the original Metaculus question, and once that question is resolved, its outcome will be applied here.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview recorded on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview took place on The Howard Stern Show in April, where Biden responded to inquiries for approximately 70 minutes. 

For this market to resolve as YES, Biden must engage in another in-person interview for a minimum of 45 minutes. If no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve as NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video could potentially contain only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes each featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a compilation of Biden's interviews along with their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will face removal or be barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The confirmation of the removal or barring must come from official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be marked as "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may occur after the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: If Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Joe Biden have a 45+ minute on-camera interview before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

Given this, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024? The interview must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. This includes appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview must be released before market close at the end of July 2024 to resolve YES. If no qualifying interview occurs, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Should Donald Trump be disqualified or barred from participating in a primary election ballot according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Joe Biden conduct an on-camera interview lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This disqualification or barring is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

In this context, will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera for over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? The interview must consist of at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person. This includes appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or an interview incorporated into a program like 60 Minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview must be made available before the market closes at the end of July 2024 to resolve as YES. If no qualifying interview takes place, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is not removed or blocked from any primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is confirmed by the absence of official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such removal or block. 

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count.

para_P.title: Assuming Donald Trump remains eligible and is not barred from any primary election ballot as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Let us consider the following scenario: By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is substantiated by the lack of formal announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources indicating any such disqualification or prevention. 

Therefore, can we affirm that Joe Biden will engage in an in-person, on-camera interview or discussion lasting a minimum of 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? This excludes events like press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are part of edited segments like those on 60 Minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person for these appearances to be considered valid.

question.title: Will Anthropic publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Anthropic will release a report detailing the findings from an external assessment of their models' safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **YES** if, on or before June 30, 2024, Anthropic issues a *public* report containing the findings from an *independent* entity evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Conditional on Anthropic publishing a report with results from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will Meta do the same?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Given this, will Meta also publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by the same date?

para_P.title: If Anthropic releases a public report on external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024, will Meta follow suit?
para_P.body: Assuming that by June 30, 2024, Anthropic has issued a *public* report detailing the findings from an *external* organization that assessed the safety of one of their AI models, will Meta likewise release a *public* report with the findings from an *external* organization evaluating the safety of one of their AI models by that same deadline?

question.title: Given Anthropic does not publish a report with external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024, will Meta publish such a report by then?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Anthropic does not release a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of their AI models by June 30, 2024. In this context, we ask whether Meta will publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of their AI models by the same date.

Resolution criteria:
- For Anthropic: Resolves YES if by June 30, 2024, Anthropic does not publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of their AI models.
- For Meta: Resolves YES if by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of their AI models.

para_P.title: If Anthropic fails to issue a report containing external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024, will Meta release such a report by that date?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the situation in which Anthropic does not make available a public report detailing the findings from an external entity that red-teamed the safety of their AI models by June 30, 2024. In this light, we question whether Meta will provide a public report with the findings from an external party that red-teamed the safety of their AI models by the same deadline.

Resolution criteria:
- For Anthropic: Resolves YES if by June 30, 2024, Anthropic has not published a public report with findings from an external party red-teaming the safety of their AI models.
- For Meta: Resolves YES if by June 30, 2024, Meta has published a public report with the findings from an external party red-teaming the safety of their AI models.
